item.title: Hidden Markov Models for Temporal Graph Representation Learning
item.description: We investigate the quality of quantitative measures that assess the utility of a graph structure for node classification tasks.

item.title: PyDGN: a Python Library for Flexible and Reproducible Research on Deep Learning for Graphs
item.description: We investigate the quality of quantitative measures that assess the utility of a graph structure for node classification tasks.

item.title: On Class Distributions Induced by Nearest Neighbor Graphs for Node Classification of Tabular Data
item.description: In this paper I try to address the following question: “Is it really worth to build a k-Nearest Neighbor graph from tabular data and then apply deep graph nets on top of it to classify each sample in the table?” This is something people tend to do, and I have always been skeptical about it. Now we have a very good indication, which I also tried to justify theoretically, that a k-NN graph is not the best structure to use if we want to gain some real advantages (under some mild conditions). I also argue that new methods of building synthetic graphs are necessary if we want to exploit some “latent” structure between the samples of a dataset.

item.title: Investigating the Interplay between Features and Structures in Graph Learning
item.description: We investigate the quality of quantitative measures that assess the utility of a graph structure for node classification tasks.

item.title: Tractable Probabilistic Graph Representation Learning with Graph-Induced Sum-Product Networks
item.description: We propose a probabilistic model that bridges graph machine learning and sum-product networks to tractably answer probabilistic queries. Our Graph-induced Sum-Product Network can solve unsupervised and supervised graph tasks and it is especially effective in modeling the missing data distribution as well as exploiting unlabeled data in a scarce supervision scenario.

item.title: The Infinite Contextual Graph Markov Model
item.description: Combining Deep Graph Networks with Bayesian nonparametric techniques to unsupervised learning of node/graph representations while automatizing the choice of the hyper-parameters during training.

item.title: Towards Learning Trustworthily, Automatically, and with Guarantees on Graphs: an Overview
item.description: An overview of the current works focused towards learning trustworthily, automatically, and with guarantees on graphs.

item.title: Catastrophic Forgetting in Deep Graph Networks: A Graph Classification Benchmark
item.description: We study the phenomenon of catastrophic forgetting in the graph representation learning scenario.

item.title: Robust Malware Classification via Deep Graph Networks on Call Graph Topologies
Graph Mixture Density Networks
item.description: Combining Deep Graph Networks with Mixture Density Networks to model multimodal output distributions conditioned on arbitrary input graphs.

item.title: Concept Matching for Low-Resource Classification
Modeling Edge Features with Deep Bayesian Graph Networks
A deep graph network-enhanced sampling approach to efficiently explore the space of reduced representations of proteins
item.description: Learning complex measure of information loss in reduce representations of proteins via deep graph networks.

item.title: Catastrophic Forgetting in Deep Graph Networks: an Introductory Benchmark for Graph Classification
item.description: An empirical work at the intersection of Continual Learning and Graph Representation Learning. Selected as one of the two oral presentations.

item.title: Theoretically Expressive and Edge-aware Graph Learning
Accelerating the identification of informative reduced representations of proteins with deep learning for graphs
Probabilistic Learning on Graphs via Contextual Architectures
item.description: Further studies on the Contextual Graph Markov Model.

item.title: A Gentle Introduction to Deep Learning for Graphs
item.description: A top-down approach to the field of machine learning for graphs.

item.title: A Fair Comparison of Graph Neural Networks for Graph Classification
item.description: A fair and robust evaluation of Deep Graph Networks for graph classification tasks.

item.title: Contextual Graph Markov Model: a Deep and Generative Approach to Graph Processing
item.description: A deep, probabilistic, and scalable machine learning model for graphs. Work done as part of my master thesis.
